item.title: Report X-2025061333
item.description:
Report X-2025061333

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-17
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Pkg is considered Undeclared as it is missing required Hazmat markings for shipment containing aerosols. Contents of original pkg repacked in FedEx repack box. Pkg was damaged at the origin terminal and Damaged Package Report (DPR) was filed. Required accompanying documents were not filed. Shipment "Service Code" designates Ltd Qty. Damaged portion (presumably non-hazardous cleaner) was removed from the original packaging and discarded. Remaining contents: laundry detergent, water filtration pitcher and sunscreen (aerosol) were repacked in the oversized FedEx carton with no packing material. Vent cap came off laundry detergent bottle allowing liquid to leak wetting and coating contents. Removal of pkg from sortation and inspection resulted in the discovery of the undeclared aerosol contents.

Gasoline SDS is provided as there is no specific SDS for "Dangerous Goods in Machinery or Apparatus".
